results.title: A Ship is born
results.brief_description: Offers an impressionistic view of shipbuilding and the baptismal launching of a ship, showing the relationship between man and his work. Shows the gaiety of the launching day contrasted with the tension of the workers, whose last job is to knock out the timber stills and send the ship down to the water.

results.title: A Ship comes to Antwerp
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Swingler, British Petroleum and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how the city of Antwerp is still dependent today on sea-borne traffic as it has been since the middle ages. Interwoven with the impression of the city is the arrival, docking, discharging, refuelling and departure of the freight ship ‘City of Karachi’. (Awards: Edinburgh Festival, 1953)

results.title: A Shifting Heart
results.brief_description: The 2nd Vatican Council, held in Rome in the 1960s, saw a massive restructuring of how Catholics approach their faith. For Australians this has meant a great deal of alteration in externals, for example the Mass today is spoken in English rather than Latin, - plus there has been a reassessment of the role of the individual Catholic in the modern world. The Roman Catholic faith has entered tumultuous times and few Catholics can idly stand by and watch the church disintegrate. However, there is an increasing mood among many Catholic lay people of assertiveness which promises well for the church’s future. Rated: G

results.title: A Shared table with Stephanie Alexander
results.creator_credit: John Smith, Stuart Menzies, Tony Wright, ABC-TV (Australia), On the Boil Productions and December Films
results.brief_description: This tape is a compilation of the seven part series screened on ABC TV which followed renowned chef Stephanie Alexander on a culinary journey across different regions of Australia. At each destination Stephanie, with the assistance of fellow chef Elena Bonnici, prepares a meal from local produce. By doing so she reveals the diversity of local producers, and the ease with which these ingredients can be incorporated into a delicious meal.

results.title: A Share in their tomorrow
results.brief_description: How a group of British companies are assisting, by aerial surveys, the Sudan Government to open up and develop unproductive, and previously inaccessible, terrain in the Sudan. The valuable contribution of the helicopter for surveying purposes is illustrated.

results.title: A Shame like Alice. Parts. 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee, SBS-TV and Lee Gordon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus”.
The plight of Australia’s Aborigines around Alice Springs. Are Aborigines being treated in accordance with the United Nations Charter which states all human beings should be free and equal? Includes interviews with Neville Bonner and Al Grassby

results.title: A Shame Like Alice. Part 2 (A)
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee, SBS-TV and Lee Gordon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Focus”.
Presents the view of the white population of Alice Springs concerning its Aborigines, including those of the mayor and a councillor concerning “assimilation” problems. Shows, in contrast, Aboriginal self-help ventures in education and health. Aborigines relate their feelings about the intrusion of the media and tourism into their lives. Includes interviews with the then Senator Neville Bonner and former Commissioner for Community Affairs, Al Grassby.

results.title: A Shame like Alice. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Leonard Lee, SBS-TV and Lee Gordon Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Focus”.
A look at the plight of the Aboriginal people in and around Alice Springs, presenting the black viewpoint. Discusses racism in the town, the type of housing and services available to the Aboriginal people and other issues. Includes interviews with the then Senator Neville Bonner and former Commissioner for Community Relations, Al Grassby.

results.title: A Set of slides
results.brief_description: Utilising over 400 photographs, the spirit of London of the 19th century is captured in dramatic style. Early modes of steam transport are shown, in particular the steam trains of the Underground. A familiar sight in the streets of London was also the horse-drawn vehicle. English people of the 19th century are also depicted at their jobs and in their leisure activities. Narrated by Anthony Quayle.

results.title: A Separate peace. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: John Knowles, Larry Peerce, Otto Plaschkes, Robert A. Goldston and Paramount Communications
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film based on the book of the same name by John Knowles. Depicts Knowles’ moving investigation of the loyalty and betrayal of friendship. Original feature film was produced in 1972.
